result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lewis Carnell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Conversion to Civil Commitment Proceedings Unser 971.14(6), Wisc. Stats. Sec. AND Emergency Dentention Statement; signed and filed.

Defendant Lewis Carnell in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Lewis Carnell in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Corporation Counsel, Attorney Dewey Martin, appeared as a friend of the Court

The doctor's report concludes that the defendant is not competent and not likely to regain competence within the statutory time limits.
No challenges to the doctor's report.
Statements made.

COURT'S RULING:  Court finds defendant is not competent and not likely to regain competence within the statutory time limits.  Court ordered this case "converted" to a civil commitment under Chapter 54 and 55.  Court ordered defendant transferred to New Beginnings Group Home under civil commitment.  Court continued the suspension of these proceedings.

Defendant will be transported to a protective placement facility pursuant to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 55.135.

Court signed proposed order at the conclusion of this hearing.

Defendant Lewis Carnell in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Lewis Carnell in custody.  Jesica Ballenger for Sara Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State requests an adjournment of the Competency Hearing to allow Corporation Counsel time to arrange an appropriate placement for the defendant.
Defense objects.
Arguments heard.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 03-21-2016 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Competency Hearing.

Defendant Lewis Carnell in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Lewis Carnell in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for Return on Doctor's Competency Restoration Report.
The doctor's report concludes that the defendant is not competent and not likely to regain competence.
State entered a challenge to the doctor's report.
Court scheduled a Competency Hearing.
Court takes defense motion to suspend the proceedings "under advisement".

Case adjourned for Competency Hearing on 03-14-2016 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.
as to defendant's Competency Restoration status prepared by psychologist, Dr. Michael Hammer - filed.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Lewis Carnell not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

PER THE PERMISSION OF JUDGE DONALD, CLERK ADJOURNED TODAY'S RETURN ON DOCTOR'S REPORT HEARING OFF THE RECORD.

The doctor's report concludes that the defendant is not yet competent to proceed.
Parties request an adjournment.
Case adjourned to 03-07-2016 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Return on Doctor's Competency Restoration Report.
as to defendant's Competency Restoration status prepared by psychologist, Dr. Dawn Laurent; filed.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant Lewis Carnell not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court to address the issue of DHS' request for an order allowing DHS to administer medications involuntarily.
The determination that defendant is not competent to refuse psychotropic medications was never made at the time defendant was ordered for in patient competency treatment.
Statements made.
A motion hearing date needs to be scheduled.
Parties will email the clerk in order to have an email sent to Mendota for purposes of scheduling a motion hearing date with Dr. Dawn Laurent to testify.

No further action taken by the Court at this time.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs appeared TELEPHONICALLY on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant Lewis Carnell not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared TELEPHONICALLY for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Opland-Dobs was in another court at 8:30 AM and now Judge Donald is currently in trial.
The doctor's report concludes that the defendant is still not yet competent to proceed.
Parties request an adjournment in 90 days.

Case adjourned to 12-01-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference as to defendant's competency restoration.
as to the defendant prepared by psychologist, Dr. Dawn Laurent; filed.
Defendant's 3 Month Competency Restoration Progress Report prepared by psychologist, Dr. Dawn Laurent; filed.
Forensic Tracking Report, received and filed.  Defendant admitted to MMHI (Mendota) on 7-21-15.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 661
cf
Forensic Tracking Report received and filed./ds
Forensic Tracking report received and filed./ds
Report dated 6-16-15 from Dr. Mark Phelps received and filed./ds
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) received and filed./ds

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lewis Carnell in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Lewis Carnell in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Compentency hearing continues.  Sworn-in for the State:  Dr. Mark Phelps (by videoconference).   State rests.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Arguments by counsel. 

Court makes findings of fact.  Court finds defendant is not competent to proceed due to mental disability rather than mental illness and it may be possible the defendant may be brought to competency within a 12 month period.

Court orders the proceedings suspended; the defendant is committed to the Department of Health Services; the department shall designate the receiving institute; the sheriff shall transport the defendant; the institute shall furnish reports at 3,6 and 9 month intervals.    

Per Chief Judge Directive of 15-10, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Branch 02, Judge Joseph Donald, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Dr. Phelps cannot appear on 6-5-15 due to a family emergency.  Case is removed from the calendar and reset for 6-17-15 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 44.  All parties notified./ds

Defendant Lewis Carnell in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Lewis Carnell in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Hearing on competency proceeds.   Defendant claims to be competent.  Attorney Opland-Dobs states the defendant is not competent.  State believes the defendant is competent.  Court will proceed under the issue that the defendant is incompetent and the State must prove the defendant is competent to proceed.  Sworn-in for the State: Dr. Mark Phelps.  Court reporter is having a very difficult time hearing the doctor by telephone.  Court will try to use the videoconference for the doctor.  Sworn-in for the defense: Dr. Christopher Tyre; Exhibit #1, 2, 3 marked, identified, offered and received into evidence; Tina C.  Court continues the competency hearing.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
Defendant's psychological report received and filed./ds

Defendant Lewis Carnell in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Lewis Carnell in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk; ds

Defense had an examination completed by Dr. Tyre and is requesting a competency hearing.  Competency hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lewis Carnell in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Lewis Carnell in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds 

Defense states he would like another examination and has found Dr. Woody would be available to perform the examination.  Court sets case for return on doctor's report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letter from Dr. Phelps received and filed./ds

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Lewis Carnell not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Dr. Phelps is requesting an extension.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Lewis Carnell not in court, in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel for Micahel Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties acknowledge receipt of a copy of the doctor's report.  Per the report, Dr. Rawski was unable to determine the defendant's competency and is asking for an In-Patient evaluation.  Court orders defendant to be transported to the designated facility for In-Patient evaluation.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Lewis Carnell not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties received doctor's report this morning.  Defense needs to review with the defendant.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Report by Dr. Robert Rawski dated 1-28-15 received and filed./ds

Defendant Lewis Carnell in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Lewis Carnell in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkel, Branch 44.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
